cards.name: Rancor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Hatred outlives the hateful.

rulings.text: If the creature this Aura would enchant is an illegal target by the time Rancor tries to resolve, the Aura spell doesn't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield, so it won't be put into a graveyard from the battlefield and its ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gains +2/+0 and trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from play, return Rancor to owner's hand.

cards.name: Repopulate
cards.text:
Shuffle all creature cards from target player's graveyard into that player's library.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Shuffle all creature cards from target player's graveyard into that player's library.
Cycling {2} (You may pay {2} and discard this card from your hand to draw a card. Play this ability as an instant.)

cards.name: Silk Net
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Sometimes it's possible to pull a meal out of thin air.

rulings.text: Both the +1/+1 and reach only last until end of turn.
This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+1 and can block creatures with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Simian Grunts
cards.text:
Flash
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor: These monkeys mean business.

rulings.text: This card is always a creature spell and is never an instant spell, no matter when you cast it.

cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
You may play Simian Grunts any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Treefolk Mystic
cards.text: Whenever Treefolk Mystic blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, destroy all Auras attached to that creature.
cards.flavor: Urza's wards fell from him like autumn leaves as he entered the dreaming grove. He awoke imprisoned in living wood.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature blocks or is blocked by Treefolk Mystic, destroy all enchantments on that creature.

cards.name: Weatherseed Elf
cards.text: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: "My grandmother once told me the future of our world was inside the Weatherseed. When I touched it, I knew she was right."
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn. (If defending player controls a forest, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Weatherseed Treefolk
cards.text:
Trample
When Weatherseed Treefolk dies, return it to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Trample
When Weatherseed Treefolk is put into a graveyard from play, return Weatherseed Treefolk to owner's hand.

cards.name: Wing Snare
cards.text: Destroy target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Argoth's doom rained from a clear sky. Yavimaya will not share that fate."
—Multani, maro-sorcerer
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with flying.

cards.name: Yavimaya Granger
cards.text:
Echo {2}{G} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Yavimaya Granger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
When Yavimaya Granger comes into play, you may search your library for a basic land card and put that land into play tapped. Shuffle your library afterward.

cards.name: Yavimaya Scion
cards.text: Protection from artifacts
cards.flavor: Each time the saw blade bit, the tree spat it out.
cards.originalText: Protection from artifacts

cards.name: Yavimaya Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Angel's Trumpet
cards.text:
All creatures have vigilance.
At the beginning of each player's end step, tap all untapped creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals damage to the player equal to the number of creatures tapped this way.

rulings.text: Angel's Trumpet affects creatures with Defender and other creatures that can't attack for some reason.
It does not affect creatures which did not attack, but which are already tapped at the time the ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Attacking does not cause creatures to tap.
At the end of each player's turn, tap all untapped creatures he or she controls that did not attack this turn. Angel's Trumpet deals 1 damage to that player for each creature tapped this way.

cards.name: Beast of Burden
cards.text: Beast of Burden's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "If it is meant to be nothing but a machine," Karn finally asked Jhoira, "why did Urza build it to be like me?"
cards.originalText: Beast of Burden has power and toughness each equal to the total number of creatures in play.

cards.name: Crawlspace
cards.text: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.
cards.flavor: The goblins did not understand their attraction to the mana rig. They simply knew it was where they belonged.

rulings.text: Your opponents can still attack planeswalkers you control with any number of creatures each combat.

cards.originalText: No more than two creatures can attack you each combat.

cards.name: Damping Engine
cards.text: A player who controls more permanents than each other player can't play lands or cast artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent for that player to ignore this effect until end of turn.

rulings.text: A player affected by this card can sacrifice a permanent any time they could cast an instant. This is a special action that doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

A player can only sacrifice a permanent to end this effect if they have more permanents than any other player, and they haven't already sacrificed a permanent to end the effect this turn. The ability to sacrifice a creature is granted by the same effect that is being ended.

cards.originalText: A player who controls more permanents than any other cannot play lands or artifact, creature, or enchantment spells. That player may sacrifice a permanent to ignore this effect until end of turn.

cards.name: Defense Grid
cards.text: Each spell costs {3} more to cast except during its controller's turn.
cards.flavor:
"We've managed to keep the goblins in their assigned areas, but there's little we can do about the smell."
—Whip Tongue, viashino technician

rulings.text: The additional cost can be reduced by effects that reduce costs, such as Sapphire Medallion.
In Two-Headed Giant, spells don't cost extra on your own turn.

cards.originalText: During each player's turn, spells played by another player cost an additional {3}.

cards.name: Grim Monolith
cards.text:
Grim Monolith doesn't untap during your untap step.
{T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.
cards.flavor: Part prison, part home.
cards.originalText:
Grim Monolith does not untap during your untap phase.
{T}: Add three colorless mana to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.
{4}: Untap Grim Monolith.

cards.name: Iron Maiden
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Iron Maiden deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.
cards.flavor: The maiden is a jealous lover.
cards.originalText: During each of your opponent's upkeeps, Iron Maiden deals 1 damage to that player for each card more than four in his or her hand.

cards.name: Jhoira's Toolbox
cards.text: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.
cards.flavor: It entertained Jhoira to craft a kit that could bring her the tools.
cards.originalText: {2}: Regenerate target artifact creature.

cards.name: Memory Jar
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player exiles all cards from their hand face down and draws seven cards. At the beginning of the next end step, each player discards their hand and returns to their hand each card they exiled this way.

rulings.text: You can't look at the cards you exiled until they return to your hand.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Memory Jar: Each player sets aside his or her hand, face down, and draws seven cards. At end of turn, each player discards his or her hand and returns to his or her hand each card he or she set aside this way.

cards.name: Quicksilver Amulet
cards.text: {4}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: "Wonderful! You got a lion on your first try. Now put it back."

rulings.text: Any 'X' in the creature's cost is treated as zero.
Putting the card onto the battlefield is optional. When the ability resolves, you can choose not to.
You don't pay any costs of that creature card, including additional costs.

cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Choose a creature card in your hand and put that creature into play.

cards.name: Ring of Gix
cards.text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor: Not every cage is made of bars.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{1}, {T}: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Scrapheap
cards.text: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Junk heaps have rats, but scrapheaps have goblins.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact or enchantment is put into your graveyard from play, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Thran Lens
cards.text: All permanents are colorless.
cards.flavor:
"Every device in the rig is evidence of Thran enlightenment. All mana was the same to them, whether from rock or water, growth or decay. Can you imagine such unity of vision?"
—Urza, journal

rulings.text: Does not make the permanents into artifacts. They are simply without color.
Does not prevent a spell or ability from adding color to permanents after this effect is applied.

cards.originalText: All permanents are colorless.

cards.name: Thran War Machine
cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Thran War Machine attacks each combat if able.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Thran War Machine attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Thran Weaponry
cards.text:
Echo {4} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap step.
{2}, {T}: All creatures get +2/+2 for as long as Thran Weaponry remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
You may choose not to untap Thran Weaponry during your untap phase.
{2}, {T}: All creatures get +2/+2 as long as Thran Weaponry remains tapped.

cards.name: Ticking Gnomes
cards.text:
Echo {3} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: It deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
Sacrifice Ticking Gnomes: Ticking Gnomes deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Urza's Blueprints
cards.text:
Echo {6} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: From concept to paper to reality.
cards.originalText:
Echo (During your next upkeep after this permanent comes under your control, pay its casting cost or sacrifice it.)
{T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Wheel of Torture
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Wheel of Torture deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.
cards.flavor: "I'd like to buy a bowel."

rulings.text: The number of cards is counted during resolution.

cards.originalText: During each of your opponents' upkeeps, Wheel of Torture deals 1 damage to that player for each card fewer than three in his or her hand.

cards.name: Faerie Conclave
cards.text:
Faerie Conclave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue Faerie creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Faerie Conclave comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one blue mana to your mana pool.
{1}{U}: Faerie Conclave becomes a 2/1 blue creature with flying until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

cards.text:
Forbidding Watchtower enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W}.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white Soldier creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:

{T}: Add one white mana to your mana pool.
{1}{W}: Forbidding Watchtower becomes a 1/5 white creature until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

cards.text:
Ghitu Encampment enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red Warrior creature with first strike until end of turn. It's still a land. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Ghitu Encampment comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one red mana to your mana pool.
{1}{R}: Ghitu Encampment becomes a 2/1 red creature with first strike until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

cards.name: Spawning Pool
cards.text:
Spawning Pool enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B}.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black Skeleton creature with "{B}: Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it regenerates, the next time it would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Spawning Pool comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one black mana to your mana pool.
{1}{B}: Spawning Pool becomes a 1/1 black creature with "{B} Regenerate this creature" until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

cards.name: Treetop Village
cards.text:
Treetop Village enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {G}.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green Ape creature with trample until end of turn. It's still a land. (If it would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
Treetop Village comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add one green mana to your mana pool.
{1}{G}: Treetop Village becomes a 3/3 green creature with trample until end of turn. This creature still counts as a land.

cards.name: Academy Rector
cards.text: When Academy Rector dies, you may exile it. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find an enchantment card if you do not want to, even if you have one in your library.
An enchantment card is any Enchantment card, including Auras.

cards.originalText: When Academy Rector is put into a graveyard from play, you may remove Academy Rector from the game. If you do, search your library for an enchantment card and put that card into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Archery Training
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on Archery Training."

rulings.text: If there is more than one Archery Training on a creature, each granted ability counts the counters on the Archery Training that granted that ability.
You do not remove counters when using the ability.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an arrow counter on Archery Training.
Enchanted creature gains "{T}: This creature deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of arrow counters on the Archery Training enchanting this creature."

cards.name: Capashen Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
{1}{W}: Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Few warriors dare to challenge a knight of Capashen. Should one do so, there is one fewer.
cards.originalText:
First strike
{1}{W}: Capashen Knight gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Capashen Standard
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{2}, Sacrifice Capashen Standard: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Benalia has no need for peacocks to serve as symbols of vanity. The Capashens strut more proudly than any bird.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{2}, Sacrifice Capashen Standard: Draw a card.

cards.name: Capashen Templar
cards.text: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Their shields are Benalia's outermost battlements.
cards.originalText: {W}: Capashen Templar gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: False Prophet
cards.text: When False Prophet dies, exile all creatures.
cards.flavor: "You lived for Serra's love. Will you not die for it?"

rulings.text: False Prophet only exiles creatures, which means only creature permanents which are on the battlefield. It won't exile itself since it is already in the graveyard.

cards.originalText: When False Prophet is put into a graveyard from play, remove all creatures from the game.

cards.name: Fend Off
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target creature this turn.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: The best defense is to not get hit.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Cycling {2}
Target creature deals no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Field Surgeon
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
cards.flavor: Commanders order soldiers to attack. Field surgeons order them to heal. Both are obeyed without question.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Prevent the next 1 damage to target creature this turn.

cards.name: Flicker
cards.text: Exile target nontoken permanent, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.
cards.flavor: Who is truer: you who are, or you who are to be?

rulings.text: It will trigger "enters the battlefield" abilities and "leaves the battlefield" abilities. Note that the card does not go to the graveyard, so it will not trigger "goes to the graveyard" abilities.

This could be used to make the target of another spell or ability illegal if this wasn't a sorcery (which makes it really hard to do that). This is because the Flickered permanent leaves the battlefield and then returns as a completely different permanent, and the targeted spell will not recognize it.

This spell effectively "resets" the permanent to being just like it was freshly cast. All counters, Auras, effects, and so on are removed when it is exiled. Then it comes back onto the battlefield like new.

cards.originalText: Remove target nontoken permanent from the game, then return it to play under its owner's control.

cards.name: Jasmine Seer
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards and gain zero life.

cards.originalText: {2}{W}, {T}: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Mask of Law and Grace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black and from red.
cards.flavor: The archangels zealously drove Serra's light into every corner of their new home as if their creator still commanded them.

rulings.text: If a text-changing effect is used to change one of the color words so it grants Protection from white, then it will cause itself to be put into the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gains protection from black and protection from red.

cards.name: Master Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Behind his eyes is the pain of every soldier his hands have healed.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 4 damage to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Opalescence
cards.text: Each other non-Aura enchantment is a creature in addition to its other types and has base power and base toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

rulings.text: Does not animate itself. But can be animated by another Opalescence.

With a Humility and two Opalescences on the battlefield, if Humility has the latest timestamp, then all creatures are 1/1 with no abilities. If the timestamp order is Opalescence, Humility, Opalescence, the second Opalescence is 1/1, and the Humility and first Opalescence are 4/4. If Humility has the earliest timestamp, then everything is 4/4.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

This is the current interaction between Humility and Opalescence: The type-changing effect applies at layer 4, but the rest happens in the applicable layers. The rest of it will apply even if the permanent loses its ability before it's finished applying. So if Opalescence, Humility, and Worship are on the battlefield and Opalescence entered the battlefield before Humility, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments. (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities. (Humility) Layer 7b: Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4. (Opalescence). Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). But if Humility entered the battlefield before Opalescence, the following is true: Layer 4: Humility and Worship each become creatures that are still enchantments (Opalescence). Layer 6: Humility and Worship each lose their abilities (Humility). Layer 7b: Humility becomes 1/1 and Worship becomes 1/1 (Humility). Humility becomes 4/4 and Worship becomes 4/4 (Opalescence).

cards.originalText: Each other global enchantment is a creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. It's still an enchantment.

cards.name: Reliquary Monk
cards.text: When Reliquary Monk dies, destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor: A thing of Serra's realm exists only by the grace of her followers' faith.
cards.originalText: When Reliquary Monk is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Replenish
cards.text: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to the battlefield. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in your graveyard.)
cards.flavor: Treasures, trinkets, trash—the relics of the past are brought forth again.

rulings.text: It determines what enchantments to return when its resolution starts. If more enchantments go to the graveyard during the resolution, those additional enchantments are ignored.
You must return Auras if possible, even if this means enchanting an opponent's permanent with a good enchantment.

Auras can only be placed on permanents that were on the battlefield before this effect started to resolve. You can't put an enchantment onto the battlefield with Replenish and put an Aura that is also entering the battlefield onto one of those enchantments.

cards.originalText: Return all enchantment cards from your graveyard to play. (Local enchantments with no permanent to enchant remain in your graveyard.)

cards.name: Sanctimony
cards.text: Whenever an opponent taps a Mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "To forgive our enemies is to forgive ourselves."

rulings.text: Gaining life is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText: Whenever one of your opponents taps a mountain for mana, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Scent of Jasmine
cards.text: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards, and thereby the amount of life gained, on resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of white cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Scour
cards.text: Exile target enchantment. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Scour can target and exile cards that aren't always enchantments, but are enchantments when Scour is cast and resolves (such as creatures turned into enchantments by Soul Sculptor). Scour's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Remove target enchantment from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Serra Advocate
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: An angel's touch can prepare a soldier for battle more than a thousand military drills.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Target attacking or blocking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Solidarity
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Their commitment to Serra is as solid as any shield.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Tethered Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
When you control no enchantments, sacrifice Tethered Griffin.
cards.flavor: Poorly trained griffins sometimes attack the noble audiences that gather to watch their progress.

rulings.text: The ability will trigger if you don't control an enchantment, even for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability.
Only checks if you control no enchantments at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution. Gaining control of an enchantment before then will not save the Griffin.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When you control no enchantments, sacrifice Tethered Griffin.

cards.name: Tormented Angel
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Falling from heaven is not as painful as surviving the impact.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Voice of Duty
cards.text: Flying, protection from green
cards.flavor:
"Next to Law is Duty, and Duty must be obeyed. If the frame of Duty is broken, none shall weave life's fabric."
—Song of All, canto 167
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from green

cards.name: Voice of Reason
cards.text: Flying, protection from blue
cards.flavor:
"Next to Grace is Reason, and Reason must be retained. If the web of Reason comes unwoven, madness will escape."
—Song of All, canto 167
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from blue

cards.name: Wall of Glare
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Wall of Glare can block any number of creatures.
cards.flavor: The blinding barrier served Benalia better than a hundred shields.
cards.originalText:
(Walls can't attack.)
Wall of Glare may block any number of creatures each combat.

cards.name: Aura Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Aura Thief dies, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move Auras.)
cards.flavor: Illusion steals reality from the unwise.

rulings.text: Gaining control of an enchantment often isn't very interesting since it probably won't change what the enchantment is doing. It only matters if the enchantment does something specifically to "you" or "an opponent" or if the enchantment has an activated ability (which only the controller can use).

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Aura Thief is put into a graveyard from play, you gain control of all enchantments. (You don't get to move local enchantments.)

cards.name: Blizzard Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.
cards.flavor: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.

cards.name: Brine Seer
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Reveal any number of blue cards in your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards, and the controller of the spell can pay {0} to stop this or not pay {0} and let it be countered.

cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Reveal any number of blue cards in your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Bubbling Beebles
cards.text: Bubbling Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Chancellor Rayne canceled the annual beeble roast. I should have married a crueler woman."
—Barrin
cards.originalText: Bubbling Beebles is unblockable as long as defending player controls an enchantment.

cards.name: Disappear
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{U}: Return enchanted creature and Disappear to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: If at first you don't succeed, run away and hide.
cards.originalText: {U}: Return enchanted creature and Disappear to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Donate
cards.text: Target player gains control of target permanent you control.
cards.flavor: Campus pranksters initiate new students with the old "beeble bomb" routine.

rulings.text: If you Donate an Aura, it stays where it is, but the targeted player now controls it.

cards.originalText: Target player gains control of target permanent you control.

cards.name: Fatigue
cards.text: Target player skips their next draw step.
cards.flavor: "Mind if I just lie down right here for a few weeks?"
cards.originalText: Target player skips his or her next draw step.

cards.name: Fledgling Osprey
cards.text: Fledgling Osprey has flying as long as it's enchanted.
cards.flavor: It isn't truly born until its first flight.
cards.originalText: Fledgling Osprey gains flying as long as it's enchanted.

cards.name: Illuminated Wings
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
{2}, Sacrifice Illuminated Wings: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: For a moment, Urza thought not of war and destruction, but of the freedom of the skies.
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gains flying.
{2}, Sacrifice Illuminated Wings: Draw a card.

cards.name: Iridescent Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Iridescent Drake enters the battlefield, put target Aura card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control attached to Iridescent Drake.

rulings.text: If you pick an Aura that can't legally enchant this card, then the enchantment stays in the graveyard.
You must pick an Aura even if there are only undesirable ones in the graveyard.

This card used to have errata that kept it from triggering if it wasn't cast from your hand. This errata has since been removed, so the ability will trigger regardless of where the Drake was before entering the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Iridescent Drake comes into play, return target enchant creature card from a graveyard to play enchanting Iridescent Drake. (You control that enchantment.)

cards.name: Kingfisher
cards.text:
Flying
When Kingfisher dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: It's tastiest when served with the fish it stole.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Kingfisher is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.

cards.name: Mental Discipline
cards.text: {1}{U}, Discard a card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Barrin drowned his doubts about Urza's project by delving ever deeper into its details.
cards.originalText: {1}{U}, Choose and discard a card from your hand: Draw a card.

cards.name: Metathran Elite
cards.text: Metathran Elite can't be blocked as long as it's enchanted.
cards.flavor: If the eyes are windows to the soul, their souls are not of this world.

rulings.text: Being "enchanted" means there is an Aura on it.

cards.originalText: Metathran Elite is unblockable as long as it's enchanted.

cards.name: Metathran Soldier
cards.text: Metathran Soldier can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: Just as Serra crafted angels of light and faith, Urza constructed an army of sorcery and power to resist the coming invasion.
cards.originalText: Metathran Soldier is unblockable.

cards.name: Opposition
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Urza says he's sane. Perhaps, but measures of sanity among planeswalkers are hard to come by."
—Barrin
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control: Tap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Private Research
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Private Research.
When enchanted creature dies, draw a card for each page counter on Private Research.

rulings.text: Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a page counter on Private Research.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, draw a card for each page counter on Private Research.

cards.name: Quash
cards.text: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: It exiles the countered spell. This is because the first sentence puts the spell into the graveyard before you continue to the second sentence.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled but all the other copies in the graveyard, hand, and library are exiled.
Quash can exile cards even if the spell countered was a copy of a spell. For example, if you Quash a Boomerang cast from an Isochron Scepter, you may search for and exile cards named Boomerang.

If Quash counters a spell that has had text spliced onto it, only the base spell may be exiled. For example, if you use Quash to counter a Kodama's Might with a Glacial Ray spliced onto it, you may search for and exile only Kodama's Might.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Counter target instant or sorcery spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Rayne, Academy Chancellor
cards.text: Whenever you or a permanent you control becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, you may draw a card. You may draw an additional card if Rayne, Academy Chancellor is enchanted.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability targets multiple permanents you control or targets you and one or more of your permanents, this triggers once for each such target.
The "if" in the card text does not have a special meaning. You check if this card is enchanted when the ability resolves and draw 1 or 2 cards.
When casting an Aura on this card, the triggered ability will resolve before the Aura enters the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Whenever you or a permanent you control is the target of a spell or ability controlled by one of your opponents, you may draw a card, and if Rayne, Academy Chancellor is enchanted, you may draw another card.

cards.name: Rescue
cards.text: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Urza, I've discovered more promising students than you and my husband have, combined. And I haven't lost a single one."
—Rayne, Academy Chancellor
cards.originalText: Return target permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Scent of Brine
cards.text: Reveal any number of blue cards in your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card revealed this way.

rulings.text: You reveal cards during resolution.

cards.originalText: Reveal any number of blue cards in your hand. Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card revealed this way.

cards.name: Sigil of Sleep
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Arrows are only one way to remove an enemy.
cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted creature deals damage to a player, return target creature that player controls to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Telepathic Spies
cards.text: When Telepathic Spies enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: "Do try to keep an open mind, would you?"
cards.originalText: When Telepathic Spies comes into play, look at target opponent's hand.

cards.name: Temporal Adept
cards.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Of course she's at the head of her class. All her classmates have disappeared."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade
cards.originalText: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Rayne once made several unkind comparisons between the bird's naked opportunism and Urza's.
cards.originalText:
Flying 
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to one of your opponents, you draw a card.

cards.name: Treachery
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Treachery enters the battlefield, untap up to five lands.
You control enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"The academy educates; I employ. It's a perfect arrangement."
—Gatha, Tolarian renegade

rulings.text: You can untap 0 to 5 lands.
You choose which lands to untap as the triggered ability resolves. They aren't targeted, and they don't have to be lands that you control.

cards.originalText:
When Treachery comes into play, untap up to five lands.
You control enchanted creature.

cards.name: Apprentice Necromancer
cards.text: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains haste. At the beginning of the next end step, sacrifice it.
cards.originalText: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Apprentice Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. That creature gains haste. At end of turn, sacrifice it. (The creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Attrition
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor:
"I will trade life for life with the insurgents. Our resources, unlike theirs, are limitless."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
cards.originalText: {B}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Body Snatcher
cards.text:
When Body Snatcher enters the battlefield, exile it unless you discard a creature card.
When Body Snatcher dies, exile Body Snatcher and return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

rulings.text: You choose whether or not to discard on resolution.
You can choose to target itself to return to the battlefield, but the exiling happens first and so the return will fail.

cards.originalText:
When Body Snatcher comes into play, you may choose and discard a creature card from your hand. If you don't, remove Body Snatcher from the game.
When Body Snatcher is put into a graveyard from play, remove Body Snatcher from the game and return target creature card from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Bubbling Muck
cards.text: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a Swamp for mana, that player adds an additional {B}.
cards.flavor: The muck claims a hundred living things for each meager treasure it spews forth.

rulings.text: Affects lands with type Swamp, not lands that are named "Swamp."
Affects lands tapped for rest of turn, not just swamps on the battlefield at the time it resolves. This is because it affects players and not the lands themselves.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, whenever a player taps a swamp for mana, it produces an additional {B}.

cards.name: Carnival of Souls
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you lose 1 life and add {B}.
cards.flavor: "'Davvol, blast those elves.' 'Davvol, transport those troops.' No one cares that today is my birthday."

rulings.text: This is not optional.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature comes into play, you lose 1 life and add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Chime of Night
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
cards.flavor: Many sent to serve Davvol carried such instruments, as if to remind him who their true masters were.
cards.originalText: When Chime of Night is put into a graveyard from play, destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.name: Disease Carriers
cards.text: When Disease Carriers dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Rath is a disease all its inhabitants carry.
cards.originalText: When Disease Carriers is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Dying Wail
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor: This is a world of spiteful wasps that sting and kill even as they die.

rulings.text: If they have less than 2 cards, they discard all the cards they have.
It only triggers on a creature going to the graveyard from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard from play, target player chooses and discards two cards from his or her hand.

cards.name: Encroach
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"The rate of spread in this region is unacceptable. Start again."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath

rulings.text: You choose a land card that is not a basic land.
If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Look at target player's hand and choose a nonbasic land card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Eradicate
cards.text: Exile target nonblack creature. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that creature and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Use the name of the card as it leaves the battlefield.

If a copy card is targeted by this effect, you get to look for another copy of the card it is copying. This is because a copy card actually takes on the name and initial characteristics of what it copies.
Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

If you manage to turn a land (such as a Forest or Stalking Stones) into a creature, you can indeed use this effect on that basic land type. Eradicate's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

A face-down creature has no name, so no card can possibly share a name with it (not even other cards with no name). If you Eradicate a face-down creature you will still search its controller's library, but you won't be able to exile any cards from that library.

cards.originalText: Remove target nonblack creature from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all copies of that card and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Festering Wound
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.

rulings.text: If it is on your creature, you can decide whether to add a counter before or after it damages you.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget, you can't go back later even if it is something you usually do.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put an infection counter on Festering Wound.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Festering Wound deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of infection counters on Festering Wound.

cards.name: Lurking Jackals
cards.text: When an opponent has 10 or less life, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Jackal creature.
cards.flavor: Often it's not the hunter or the hunted but the opportunist who thrives in Rath.

rulings.text: Once it becomes a creature, it will not change back into an enchantment if your opponent's life total goes back above 10.
Once it becomes a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: When one of your opponents has 10 life or less, if Lurking Jackals is an enchantment, it becomes a 3/2 Hound creature.

cards.name: Nightshade Seer
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

rulings.text: You can reveal zero cards to give -0/-0 to a creature.

cards.originalText: {2}{B}, {T}: Reveal any number of black cards in your hand. Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Phyrexian Monitor
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Phyrexian Monitor.
cards.flavor: Being one would be an honor, if the word "honor" had any meaning in Phyrexia.
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Phyrexian Monitor.

cards.name: Phyrexian Negator
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice that many permanents.
cards.flavor: They exist to cease.

rulings.text: Sacrificing this card does not prevent you from having to make the other sacrifices.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Whenever Phyrexian Negator is dealt damage, sacrifice a permanent for each 1 damage dealt to it.

cards.name: Plague Dogs
cards.text:
When Plague Dogs dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Plague Dogs: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: "They're not just retrievers, they're carriers."
cards.originalText:
When Plague Dogs is put into a graveyard from play, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
{2}, Sacrifice Plague Dogs: Draw a card.
